text_blocks.snippet: Free or low-cost counseling in North Vancouver is available through several community agencies, offering support for individuals, families, and youth. Key resources include Family Services of the North Shore (up to 6 free sessions), CMHA North and West Vancouver (short-term, low-cost for adults), and Foundry North Shore (youth drop-in). Services often include phone, online, and in-person options.
Key Free/Low-Cost Counseling Services in North Vancouver:

list.snippet: Family Services of the North Shore: Offers free, short-term counselling (up to 6 sessions) for residents, particularly for those impacted by COVID-19, including anxiety, depression, and grief support. They also provide sliding-scale counseling.
CMHA North and West Vancouver: Provides short-term, low-cost, confidential, one-to-one counselling for adults (19+).
Foundry North Shore: Offers free, drop-in mental health counselling for youth aged 12-24.
Peer Assisted Care Team (PACT): A community-led, mental health response for North and West Vancouver, available by calling 1-888-261-7228.
REACH Medical Clinic: Offers free virtual counseling sessions covered by MSP.
Parkgate Community Services Society: Provides community-based, low-cost counseling.
HealthLink BC (8-1-1): A service that can connect residents with local resources and mental health professionals.
Hope for Wellness Help Line: 1-855-242-3310 (for Indigenous peoples).
Crisis Centre of BC: 310-6789 (no area code needed).
North Vancouver Family Justice Centre: Offers family counseling services.

text_blocks.snippet: It is recommended to call or check the websites of these organizations directly to confirm availability, eligibility, and wait times, as some programs are temporary or require intake assessments.
